description: Oksana Lintz, alone in the Oversight Directorate late at night, decides to execute the BCI reset protocol. She reasons that wiping all scores is the only fair way to break the cycle of privilege and surveillance.
The BCI reset begins silently: technicians observe blanked compliance profiles and system dashboards. Service providers are notified that behavioral scores are no longer valid for access control.
Residents across the city wake to find BCI scores and privilege flags erased. Confusion, relief, and fear mix as all digital rankings and restrictions vanish overnight.

Without digital rankings, access to jobs, housing, and services grows chaotic. People confront one another as equals for the first time in years, negotiating new roles and agreements as mistrust and new alliances form.

A posthumous video from Halden surfaces online, revealing he built the reset as a contingency for Council collapse. He urges citizens to shape their own future without automated control. Spontaneous assemblies form as residents debate new principles and ways of organizing city life.
